title: rahulzx
author: rahulzx
content: Can we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: What are the project you wanna test and how do you tends to trust any newly launch project without knowing their true intentions towards their testing service especially altcoin projects.Whatever you are doing with any altcoin can be seen as gambling because anything could likely happened at the cost of doing the test run.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Talking about trust,  that should be far away from your features for analyzing a potential coin,  we are already at a level where most of the new projects are all aimed and targeted at the hypes like the meme coins development and the rest of what have you,  it clear that in holding on to any of them you have to make up your mind to accept whatever risks that are associated with them and also being able to make up for what I call gambler mindset while holding such coins. Although you did not mention any coin as a list for us to work with,  but then we must be talking about another meme coin altogether.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: No, you can't expect this.Most of project who have a testing-phase is always respond you, there is no reward/airdrop. It's their policy, even they have a reward/airdrop is always being secret they want the user testing by them self without expect like that.Most of the time, the user it self who are speculation have some potential airdrop for the project.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: It depends. What are the requirements?Testing it doesn't mean you will be paid instantly. I bet they will need some proof that you really did it because there will be people who will cheat and in the crypto world there are lots of them. Also, don't expect too much. It's not like this is the era where airdrops are worth it anymore. Most of them are either dust or developers just playing around and in the end, they will just take the money and run with it. It sounds pessimistic but it's the reality when it comes to bounties and I think this kind of test runs are just like them. Finally, be careful with what you will join in especially if they are requiring you to fill up information to prove your legitimacy. There are chances they will use your info for different bad purposes.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on October 02, 2023, 01:51:56 PMCan we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?Honestly with the past results of some testnets, users were discourage to do some of these task due to low rewards. Example of these are sei which has a very low value due to massive participants and a very few alloted budget for the testnet. Also the sui which chosen to do a random whitelisting which ignored the testnet users full activity and opted to do a small group of people reward by random lottery. Well some also low class projects giving a false hope and only non valued nfts.

comments.author: Beerwizzard
comments.body: Regarding retrodrops and airdrops I still see some issues:1. Most of them are not announced in advance and users should proceed with activities only based on rumors and you can't be 100% sure that something wouldn't go wrong. Many airdrop hunters expected a retrodrop from SUI and it ended being a waste of effort once it went public. 2.You need to pay the transaction fee with your own money at the time of activities. And if it is some kind of ETH L2, then these fees can be high, although you cannot be sure that you will not fail on some criteria or the retrodrop will take place at all.

comments.author: abel1337
comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on October 02, 2023, 01:51:56 PMCan we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?Due to projects that gave rewards to their users who participated on their testnets using their tokens, it simply became a trend and now we've saw projects that are doing it more than ever. Bunch of projects copied it but don't really indicate that they will have an airdrop for users who participated. So it's easy to say to don't expect rewards from them. Though the airdrop rewards nowadays aren't that high anymore compared to the past once and people who tried where demotivated because they experience losses because of mainly the transaction fee spent.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on October 02, 2023, 01:51:56 PMCan we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?Most projects will never pay anything to their testers. They pay out only every 20 projects, or less often. When you do testnets, be prepared that you will just waste your time and it will not be rewarded in any way. This is a feature of this industry, so don't expect every testnet to be rewarding. New testnets appear every day, and only 10-15 projects get good rewards per year.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on October 02, 2023, 01:51:56 PMCan we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?Depends on the projects success rate. Sure, those testers that have done it on a project that became successful later on managed to get some airdrops and rewards from that. But you can't just hope that all of them are going to be the same. Having a timeframe for these projects is hard to expect to. If you're just for the testing, I think it's a good opportunity because you can add it on your portfolio as seems to be like a QA or project tester.Whether the project succeeds or not, you've got it on your file.

comments.author: Kelvinid
comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on October 02, 2023, 01:51:56 PMCan we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?That will depend on the nature of the project because I don't think they all deserve to test nor do we have to waste our time with them either. Can you cite an example? Indeed, so many projects have been created but the majority of them are worthless. Therefore, I would tell you OP not to expect any rewards from them if ever you participated in their airdrops or bounties as you will just get disappointed. Well, I don't stop you from doing that but as I've said, never expect to much from them either.

comments.author: Fardoche
comments.created_time: October 02, 2023, 09:31:00 PMLast edit: October 02, 2023, 09:45:51 PM by Fardoche
comments.body: Unfortunately most projects are doomed to fail. They look good at first next thing you know they stop making updates. When is the last time we've seen a long term project?

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on October 02, 2023, 01:51:56 PMCan we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?for me I assume that what you are saying doesn't have any root right now because their is no much explanation concerning what your are saying, because nobody understands you base on the kind of project you are emphasise on, in the aspect  of participating in project what really matters is that you have to know that before you venture in any project you have to understand the project before any other like making a requirement of the project.

comments.author: JeffBrad12
comments.body: if what you meant is the retroactive feel free to test the blockchain out but there's no guarantee that you will get anything while all the qualifications aren't even disclosed yet.after all sometime they might have some ridiculous and abstract qualifications to get whitelisted or receiving an airdrop from them.even though you have spent massive amounts of money for gas, you'd still more likely to waste it than to earn something afterward.however if if its testing their test blockchain don't expect too much, few months has passed and none of the project that encourage testing their testnet blockchain give any meaningful rewards.

comments.author: ahyadinnn
comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on October 02, 2023, 01:51:56 PMCan we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?what project are you referring to? if the project is holding a testnet only without any airdrop allocation it is better to avoid because it is just a waste of time, but if there is an allocation for airdrop there is nothing wrong with trying while it is free, because I am also one of the people who always follow several testnets.

comments.author: shinratensei_
comments.body: Quote from: Fardoche on October 02, 2023, 09:31:00 PMUnfortunately most projects are doomed to fail. They look good at first next thing you know they stop making updates. When is the last time we've seen a long term project?there are actually quite many long term project has been released these time around, the ones with partnership of reputable venture capital that invests million dollars.project like optimism, sui, arbitrum, and many more are definitely long term l2 project that exists for the sake of solving problem.its not some random project trying to do the same thing and just trying to grow market capitalization they are solving urgent problem here that is the gas fee of ethereum.and honestly, there are many other project out there that just as good its just some new altcoins are indeed doomed to fail from the start if they are just fundamentally bad.

comments.author: mainhe91842
comments.body: When participating in an Airdrop, you shouldn't set too high expectations for a project because there have been many projects that promised but didn't deliver Airdrops to users, a recent example being the SUI project. You can participate in multiple projects at the same time with the mindset that you may not receive anything from the project.

comments.author: i10nheeme91
comments.body: You can focus on completing tasks for multiple projects, but I would advise you to create multiple accounts to receive more rewards. If you only concentrate on one project, and it doesn't distribute an Airdrop to users, you may feel disappointed and lose trust in Airdrop events, missing out on many other opportunities. In reality, tasks for projects with Airdrop programs can be quite challenging for newcomers. It's not as easy as before because there are many people cheating by using multiple accounts to earn more rewards. This also reduces the effectiveness of the project's marketing efforts.

comments.author: Questat
comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on October 02, 2023, 01:51:56 PMCan we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?I don't generalize that all of them are just a waste of time but just like the opinion of other members and as an investor, I'm not sure if they are quite fulfilling to try either. Because I didn't expect it to be profitable or expect great rewards as can't deny the fact that most of the new projects are worthless and scams. My experience tells me that new projects are too unfortunate and far from what I experienced in the past where we can enjoy participating and investing in them because the rewards are great.

comments.author: royalfestus
comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on October 02, 2023, 01:51:56 PMCan we expect any rewards , for participating in them in Q4 2023?Are you referring to a startup project, an existing project on an exchange, or any other type of cryptocurrency test?
